xml.brief: Get the list of all OKAPI attributes (A-codes)

desc.p: This method return all currently defined OKAPI geocache-attributes. Useful when you want to cache the data on the client-side.

Keep in mind, that the number of attributes will grow. If your application uses multiple OKAPI servers, then you should use one of the frequently updated servers for pre-caching attribute data (currently, Opencaching.PL is the most frequently updated installation). Also, you should never assume that you have the complete list (why, a new attribute might got created just as you were reading this!).
Once an attribute is published via this method, it won't disappear, nor will its meaning change. It may get deprecated though.

xml.opt: Works the same as in the attribute method.
Works the same as in the attribute method.

Deprecated attributes are not used by the newest versions of OKAPI, but they can still appear in some contexts, i.e. within the data you have downloaded prior their deprecation. That's why, by default, all attributes are returned, including the deprecated ones. You may skip the deprecated attributes by passing false to this parameter.
xml.returns: A dictionary. A-codes you provide will be mapped to dictionary keys, and each value will be an object, as described in the attribute method.
